intro: Euphrasia officinalis f. brevidens, commonly known as the short-leaved eyebright, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy, narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are shorter and more densely packed compared to the typical form of Euphrasia officinalis. This variety is valued for its traditional medicinal uses, particularly for eye conditions and inflammatory ailments.
